org.sm.smtools.application.util

Class JGUIComponentCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sm.smtools.application.util.JGUIComponentCache

  • public final class JGUIComponentCache
extends java.lang.Object
    The JGUIComponentCache class provides a mechanism for caching GUI components.

    When an application based on Java's Swing framework is running, a lot of classes need to be loaded into the Java Virtual Machine's memory. This can be perceived as an annoyance to the user because of the (sometimes long) waiting times.

    In order to circumvent this, an implementer can choose to preload some GUI components to a cache (using the addComponent(Component) method). This way, the waiting time is transferred to the application's startup (instead of during its execution). Later on, when a GUI component is needed, the application can just retrieve it from the cache (using the retrieveComponent(int) method).

    Important remark

    It is the caller's responsability to take care of the bookkeeping: a unique identifier is associated with each cached component. And although this identifier is automatically assigned, it has to be maintained by the caller itself in order to be able to retrieve the component at a later instance.

    Note that this class cannot be subclassed!

    Version:
    20/01/2012
    Author:
    Sven Maerivoet

        Adds an AWT Component to the cache.

      • retrieveComponent

        public java.awt.Component retrieveComponent(int componentID)
        Retrieves a previously added AWT Component from the cache.
        Parameters:
        componentID - the unique identifier of the AWT Component to retrieve
        Returns:
        the AWT Component associated with the requested identifier
        See Also:
        addComponent(Component)

      • updateComponentTreeUI

        public void updateComponentTreeUI()
        Changes the look-and-feel of all components currently in the cache.

        Note that the current look-and-feel is used when changing the components.
